job_description: We‚Äôre hiring an Entry-Level Administrative Assistant (Work From Home) to support daily operations across the UAE and Saudi market. training providedWork detailsType: Full-time or part-time options depending on workloadLocation: RemoteSchedule: Flexible windows but consistent availability requiredWhy this role is a great fitThis is a strong ‚Äúfoundation role‚Äù that builds real operational skills: spreadsheet mastery, admin workflow, data hygiene, documentation, and task tracking. Role OverviewThe Controllership Team supports the development and delivery of the commercial strategy across EMEA markets. The team also supports business operations through financial management, analysis, and decision support.The Accounts Receivable and Claims Analyst is a key member of the EMEA Controllership team. The role is responsible for managing a customer portfolio across EMEA to ensure timely collection of Accounts Receivable balances in line with agreed payment terms and Credit Policy. Key objectives include reducing aged receivables, improving DSO, resolving overdue balances and claims, and ensuring all Accounts Receivable reporting and working capital requirements are met.Accuracy and attention to detail are critical to success in this role.The position reports into the EMEA Accounts Receivable & BPO Associate Manager and works closely with the EMEA Business Finance, Commercial, and Customer Supply Chain teams to ensure strong controllership support, execution of corporate processes, and achievement of business targets.Key ResponsibilitiesCredit ManagementPrepare credit analysis of customer financial data to support the EMEA Credit Manager in assessing credit risk for new customers.Support annual and periodic credit reviews to assess the appropriateness of existing customer credit limits.Credit Management ReportingAssist the EMEA Credit Manager in preparing credit management reporting for the EMEA Credit Committee.Provide detailed credit risk reporting by regional hubs, including commentary and action plans.Credit Release ManagementReview customer credit for blocked sales orders.Obtain approval to release blocked orders and process releases in SAP in accordance with Credit Policy and agreed SLAs.CollectionsEnsure reconciliation and collection of all Accounts Receivable balances in line with agreed payment terms and the Dunning process.Produce customer statements and dunning notifications according to the defined dunning cycle.Initiate approved customer refunds in accordance with agreed terms to avoid penalties.Cash AllocationProcess cash receipt exceptions in HighRadius and the SAP sub-ledger.Separate and allocate customer deductions and claims, ensuring all cash is allocated on the day of receipt.Claims & Deductions ManagementValidate customer claims, ensuring appropriate supporting documentation (e.g. trade investment invoices, debit notes, customer correspondence).Initiate and monitor workflows to secure approvals and timely resolution.Collaborate with Customer Service, Commercial, and Master Data teams to resolve customer deductions via credit notes or cash allocation.Handle rejected claims (e.g. penalties) and support resolution.Reporting & Period-End SupportSupport balance sheet reconciliations.Report on litigations, trade investments, and accrual balances.Identify and support required adjustments at period end.Doubtful Debt Provision SupportConduct regular reviews of aged receivables and past-due balances.Liaise with the EMEA Credit Manager, Commercial teams, and Shared Services Centre to ensure timely recognition of doubtful debt provisions and appropriate audit documentation.Processes, Systems & ControlsReview and improve systems, tools, and processes to ensure:Effective internal controlsIntegrity of financial informationEfficient and cost-effective service deliveryEnsure all AR activities comply with internal policies, procedures, and SOX controls.Initiatives & Team CollaborationContribute to continuous improvement initiatives and best-practice sharing across Finance and Controllership.Support ad hoc tasks, system changes, and process-related projects as required.Work collaboratively with regional and global teams to support corporate Accounts Receivable initiatives.Audit, Statutory & Tax SupportProvide Accounts Receivable support during internal and external audits.Assist with statutory reporting requirements, including VAT, tax returns, and Intrastat submissions.What We Are Looking ForRequired Skills & ExperienceMinimum 3+ years‚Äô experience in Customer Service, Credit, and Collections, ideally within FMCG.Strong communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally.Fluent German and English (minimum B2 level, verbal and written); additional European languages are a plus.Strong numerical aptitude and analytical skills.Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, functions, pivot tables).Highly organised, able to manage deadlines efficiently.Customer-focused with a strong service mindset.Flexible, responsive working style with tenacity and sound judgement.High attention to detail.Proactive, self-driven, and able to take initiative.Preferred Skills & ExperienceExperience with HighRadius, SAP FI/CO, and SAP SD modules.Knowledge of Trade Investments and Accounts Receivable processes.Experience working closely with Commercial and Customer Service teams. Join the Team at ABYAT - Your Gateway to Retail Excellence!About usAre you ready to be part of the largest retail store in the Middle East? ABYAT, spanning an impressive 22,000 square meters and offering over 22,000 products, is your one-stop destination for all things home improvement and more. From elegant tiles and captivating wallpapers to state-of-the-art lighting solutions and stylish kitchen fixtures, we pride ourselves on offering a diverse array of top-quality products under one roof.Established locally with a vision for excellence, ABYAT has been setting benchmarks since its inception in September 2005. This role collaborates closely with category managers, content, e-commerce, and marketing teams to ensure the catalog reflects up-to-date product information, supports seamless life cycle management, and enables an optimal customer experience.Job Description:‚Ä¢ Coordinate regularly with category managers for product updates (new launches, discontinued items, assortment changes).‚Ä¢ Ensure timely and accurate catalog updates across online and/or offline platforms.‚Ä¢ Apply proper categorisation, tagging, and product mapping to ensure discoverability and structure.‚Ä¢ Review and validate all product information including titles, descriptions, specifications, pricing, and imagery.‚Ä¢ Ensure consistency, brand alignment, and compliance with internal standards.‚Ä¢ Maintain version control and structured documentation of catalog changes.‚Ä¢ Monitor catalog performance to identify gaps, missing assets, or inconsistencies.‚Ä¢ Highlight content or data issues impacting customer experience.‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements in product presentation and data quality.‚Ä¢ Liaise with content, e-commerce, commercial, and marketing teams for campaigns and product launches.‚Ä¢ Support internal teams with catalog -related data requests or clarifications.‚Ä¢ Coordinate with tech and ERP teams when needed for data sync or structural changes.‚Ä¢ Manage updates throughout the product life cycle from listing to phase-out.‚Ä¢ Track active, inactive, and end-of-life items to maintain catalog accuracy.‚Ä¢ Ensure proper documentation and governance around changes.Qualifications/Requirements‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì5 years of experience in catalog management, merchandising, or content editing (preferably in retail or e-commerce).‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail, structured mindset, and ability to manage high data volumes.‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with product data, taxonomies, and life cycle processes.‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) and/or Content Management Systems (CMS).‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required.‚Ä¢ Experience working with ERP systems is an advantage.‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and coordination skills.Ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities simultaneously. job_description: La IWF suntem in plina expansiune si cautam un Key Account Manager cu mindset de business, orientat atat spre dezvoltarea de clienti noi (hunting), cat si spre cresterea si consolidarea portofoliului existent (farming).Daca iti place sa construiesti relatii solide, sa identifici oportunitati si sa transformi conexiunile in parteneriate profitabile, s-ar putea sa fii exact persoana pe care o cautam.Ce vei face:Vei identifica si atrage clienti noi (hunting)Vei gestiona si dezvolta relatiile cu clientii existenti (farming)Vei construi parteneriate pe termen lungVei negocia si incheia contracte de serviciiVei colabora indeaproape cu echipele interne pentru livrarea solutiilor catre clientiVei avea impact direct in cresterea businessuluiCautam pe cineva care:Are minimum 3 ani experienta in vanzarea de servicii B2BAre experienta reala atat in hunting, cat si in farmingVorbeste limba engleza la nivel minim B2Detine permis de conducere categoria BAre studii superioare finalizateEste orientat catre rezultate, relatie cu clientul si dezvoltare continuaAre initiativa si autonomie in abordarea oportunitatilorCe oferim:Rol cu vizibilitate si impact real in companieMediu dinamic, orientat spre performantaPachet financiar competitiv + bonusuri de performantaTichete de masaAbonament medical Regina MariaLibertate de actiune si sustinere din partea echipeiPosibilitatea de a creste odata cu businessulüí° De ce IWF?Suntem un grup in plina dezvoltare, cu planuri clare de crestere si proiecte ambitioase la nivel national si international. La IWF vei avea oportunitatea sa contribui direct la dezvoltarea businessului, sa lucrezi cu clienti diversi si sa faci parte dintr-o echipa care pune accent pe implicare, performanta si evolutie profesionala. Oferim contextul potrivit pentru oamenii care vor mai mult decat un job ‚Äì vor sa construiasca si sa lase amprenta.üì© Aplica acum si vino sa construim impreuna succesul IWF! Show more Show less

job_description: Job Identification:Coca-Cola ƒ∞√ßecek is seeking a Treasury Executive who reports to Head of Group Treasury. This role will be responsible for monitoring Group cash, debt and financial risk management, and execution of related transactions. In addition, this pivotal role will be at the forefront of improving the digital transformation of treasury operations. The successful candidate will play a crucial part in driving the automation of processes and the strategic implementation of new technologies to enhance efficiency and accuracy in treasury management. This includes leveraging innovative solutions to automate routine tasks, adopting treasury management systems, and staying on top of emerging technologies.Success in this role requires collaboration, communication, leadership, accountability, curiosity, multitasking and ability to see issues in their correct context, the big picture.What We Expect:Cash Management & Liquidity:¬∑ Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with banking partners to negotiate favorable terms and services and to improve the collection systems (i.e. POS, Direct Debit System).¬∑ Drive initiatives to improve Cash Flow and Net Working Capital¬∑ Utilize treasury management systems and technology tools to streamline cash management processes.¬∑ Develop and maintain accurate cash flow forecasts to anticipate funding requirements and manage long & short-term hedging strategies to minimize foreign currency, interest rate and liquidity risk.Funding & Corporate Finance:¬∑ Conduct the legal and financial processes for new funding projects and ensuring that all funding transactions of the Group are aligned with the Group strategies and priorities.¬∑ Conduct intercompany loan processes (rationalize funding need, legal issues, and approvals).¬∑ Contribute to cash management strategy and propose new approaches to maximize the return on excess cash.Controls and Reporting:¬∑ Control and confirm Treasury related figures on both management and CMB reports.¬∑ Participate in Annual Business Plan and Rolling Estimate processes of CCI countries.¬∑ Prepare regular reports to senior management and board of directors (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly basis).Risk Management:¬∑ Monitor FX market for execution of Foreign Exchange transactions (both for portfolio and trading purposes).¬∑ Monitor and analyze foreign exchange, money, and commodity markets (sugar, aluminum, and resin) propose/execute financial solutions based on the levels approved by CCI‚Äôs Board.Process and Technology:¬∑ Launch of the Treasury Management System (TMS) and other financial technologies, while ensuring efficient usage of assigned resources.¬∑ Analyze and re-engineer existing treasury processes to improve workflow efficiency and reduce manual intervention.Qualifications:¬∑ University degree and master's degree (preferable) from reputable universities in Economics or Business Administration.¬∑ Prior experience working with a TMS.¬∑ Min. 6 years of experience in a multinational organization and/or same experience in corporate banking.¬∑ Advanced level of English, Russian is a plus.¬∑ A good team member working for the team success.¬∑ Strong on analytical thinking and problem solving as well as interpersonal communication.¬∑ Ability to work cross-functionally and independently.¬∑ Knowledge on SAP and excellent knowledge Microsoft office application tools,¬∑ Good understanding, knowledge, and interest on global financial markets.What We Embrace:‚ÄúPeople Centered‚Äù FocusEqual Salary job_description: IntroductionIn this role, you will join IBM Consulting via our world-class Associates Program for university and college hires. At IBM Consulting, you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients worldwide. Our clients' technical and business needs are constantly evolving. We're hiring inspired, talented individuals who believe no problem is too big to solve.We focus on your professional development through ongoing learning, mentorship, development of technical skills, and continuous personal growth, all grounded in a culture of coaching and career advancement. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning and who wants to unleash your potential, the IBM Consulting Associates Program is for you.A career in IBM Consulting is rooted in long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe.Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation for success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions that result in ground-breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.Your Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a Package Consultant at IBM, you will assist clients in the selection, implementation, and production support of application packaged solutions, such as SAP, to meet client needs. Leveraging a growth mindset, you're ready and willing to deliver business value, wherever needed. In your role, you may be responsible for: Assist clients in selection, implementation, and support of packaged software solutions Support strategic recommendations and leverage business knowledge to drive solutions for clients and their management Facilitate or support workshops, meetings, project management and stakeholder interviews Develop process maps to understand As-Is and To-Be scenariosPreferred EducationNoneRequired Technical And Professional ExpertiseThe successful candidate will possess a proactive mindset and a keen ability to adapt to a dynamic work environment. While technical skills and project management abilities are very important, the candidate's leadership potential, client interaction experience, and ability to work effectively within a team will be significant assets to their success in this role.Initiative & Resourcefulness: Ability to take the lead and find innovative solutions independently.Critical Thinking & Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex issues and devise effective solutions.Communication Skills: Proficiency in conveying ideas clearly and effectively in both written and verbal formats.Time Management: Proven ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.Project Management & Planning: Basic understanding of organizing tasks, resources, and timelines to complete projects efficiently.Documentation Skills: Ability to maintain accurate and organized records, reports, and other documentation.Analytical Skills: Strong aptitude for evaluating data, identifying trends, and making data-driven decisions.Adaptability: Capacity to adjust to change.Teamwork: Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.Openness to assist clients in the design, business architect, process development, functional implementation, and support of applications.Ability to thrive in an ever changing, technology-based Consulting environment.A passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view.Quantitative analysis skills and ability to derive recommendations informed by data and insights.Willingness to travel.Preferred Technical And Professional ExperienceAssist clients in selection, implementation, and support of packaged software solutions.Leverages business knowledge to drive solutions for clients and their managementDrive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results.Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, while maintaining focus in an environment with conflicting demands.Leadership in Extracurricular Activities: Participation in activities that show leadership and a positive impact on the group or project.Customer Service or Client Interaction Experience: Familiarity with engaging and managing customer or client relationships.Presentation or Sales Pitch Experience: Experience delivering presentations or pitches to peers or clients, showcasing communication and persuasion skills.Effective Client Management: Experience in understanding and addressing client needs and expectations.Ability to translate business solutions into technical requirements. job_description: As the Director for Relationship Management of Global Subsidiaries within the Corporate and Institutional Banking (CIB) division, you will play a pivotal role in strengthening and expanding our client relationships. Your core mission will be to understand and anticipate the unique banking needs of multinational subsidiary companies, providing tailored financial solutions that meet their business objectives. You will lead strategic initiatives that drive portfolio growth while ensuring compliance and risk management standards are upheld.In this position based in Ho Chi Minh City, you will engage closely with key stakeholders, including senior executives within client organisations and internal teams across various functions. job_title: Deputy Director (Maritime Network and Partnerships Office)
job_description: [What the role is]You will be part of the Maritime Network and Partnerships Office (MNPO) under the MPA Academy Division to support efforts to reinforce Singapore‚Äôs role as a Global Hub Port and leading International Maritime Centre. Reporting to the Director, you will lead the strategic planning, curation, and execution of the Singapore Maritime Week (SMW) ‚Äî MPA‚Äôs flagship event and one of the world‚Äôs leading maritime shows, that convenes global thought leaders, industry executives, innovators, policymakers, and partners. This role shapes the overall programme narrative, oversees programme officers and the appointed event management vendor to deliver a world-class event that showcases Singapore‚Äôs maritime leadership.[What you will be working on]Your main roles and responsibilities include:Lead the strategic planning and programme direction for Singapore Maritime Week; shape a cohesive, forward-looking programme across leadership dialogues, conferences, exhibitions, talent initiatives, and community events.Lead programme design and work with internal divisions to curate high-quality keynotes, panels etc. aligned with maritime priorities such as decarbonisation, digitalisation, and talent development consistent with the overall theme.Serve as the primary liaison for senior stakeholders and partners across government, industry, academic institutions, corporations and international organisations etc.Liaise and coordinate with partners to facilitate their involvement and participation in SMW.Provide regular updates to internal and external stakeholders and management and oversee the secretariat functions of the programme office.Manage and mentor a team of programme officers; oversee event management vendors to ensure seamless delivery.Execute, monitor and control all aspects of SMW and related programmes, including master schedules, strategically utilising resources to achieve the objectives within the agreed timelines, costs and performance expectations.Oversee post-event evaluation and undertake regular review to benchmark SMW against global maritime and business events to ensure continued relevance and thought leadership.[What we are looking for]At least 8 to 10 years of work experience in leading major events, conferences, or strategic programmes ‚Äî ideally at national, regional, or international scale.Excellent stakeholder management, communications, and copywriting skillsDemonstrated leadership capabilities with experience managing teams and external vendors.Passion for the maritime sector and eagerness to contribute to Singapore‚Äôs role as a global maritime hub.Highly organised, adaptable, and able to thrive in fast-paced environments. job_description: Our client is leading global real estate organization backed by one of Canada‚Äôs largest pension funds. The company oversees a portfolio of office, retail, industrial, and life sciences assets amongst others across global markets. They are in search of a Senior Financial Analyst to join them for a 6-month contract.
